Biographical Sketch cont.: Sandra K. Lemmon PUBLICATIONS (Total of 23, **Most significant publications) Publications since 1993: **K.K. Nelson and S.K. Lemmon, "Suppressors of Clathrin Deficiency; Overexpression of Ubiquitin Rescues Lethal Strains of Clathrin Deficient Saccharomyces cerevisiae", Mol. Cell. Biol. 13:521-532 (1993). C.W. Bazinet, A.L. Katzen, M. Morgan, A.P. Mahowald and S.K. Lemmon, "The Drosophila Clathrin Heavy Chain: Clathrin Function is Essential in a Multicellular Organism", Genetics 134:1119-1134 (1993). G.S. Payne and S_.K. Lemmon, CHCI, in Guidebook to the Secretory Pathway, J. Rothblatt, P. Novick and M.J. Gething, eds., Sambrook and Tooze Pub. at Oxford Univ. Press, New York, pp 267-269 (1994). J.D. Stepp, A. Pellicena-Palle, S. Hamilton, T. Kirchhausen, and S.K. Lemmon, "A Late Golgi Sorting Function for Saccharomyces cerevisiae Apm1p, but not for Apm2p, a Second Yeast Clathrin AP Medium Chain-Related Protein", Mol. Biol. Cell. 6:41-58 (1995). **D.M. Gelperin, J.W. Weigle, K.K. Nelson, P.H. Roseboom, K. Irie, K. Matsumoto and S.K. Lemmon, "14-3-3 Proteins: Potential Roles in Vesicular Transport and Ras Signaling in Saccharomyces cerevisiae", PNAS 92: 11539-11543 (1995). **K.K. Nelson, M. Holmer, and S_.K. Lemmon, "SCD5, a Suppressor of Clathrin-Deficiency, Encodes a Novel Protein with a Late Secretory Function in Yeast", Mol. Biol. Cell., 7: 245-260 (1996). K. Huang, L. Gullberg, K. Nelson, C. Stefan, K. Blumer and S. K. Lemmon, "Novel Functions for Clathrin Light Chains: Clathrin Heavy Chain Trimerization is Defective in Light Chain-Deficient Yeast", submitted. Other relevant publications: C.M. Moehle, R.A. Tizard, S.K. Lemmon, J. Smart and E.W. Jones, "Protease B of the Lysosome-like Vacuole of the Yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae is Homologous to the Subtilisin Family of Serine Proteases, Mol. Cell. Biol. 7:4390-4399 (1987). **S_.K. Lemmon and E.W. Jones, "Clathrin Requirement for Normal Growth of Yeast," Science, 238:504-509 (1987). S.K. Lemmon, V.P. Lemmon and E.W. Jones, "Characterization of Yeast Clathrin and Anti-Clathrin Heavy Chain Monoclonal Antibodies," J. Cell. Biochem. 36:329-340 (1988). S.K. Lemmon, C.L. Freund, K. Conley and E.W. Jones, "Genetic Instability of Clathrin Deficient Strains of Saccharomyces cerevisiae," Genetics 124:27-38 (1990). **S_.K. Lemmon, A. Pellicena-Palle, K. Conley and C.L. Freund, "Sequence of the Clathrin Heavy Chain from Saccharomyces cerevisiae and Requirement of the C-terminus for Clathrin Function," J. Cell Biol. 112:65-80 (1991). Y. Nakayama, M. Goebl, B.O. Greco, S_.K. Lemmon, E.P. Chow and T. Kirchhausen, "The Medium Chains of the Mammalian Clathrin-Associated Proteins have a Homolog in Yeast", Eur. J. Biochem. 202:569-574 (1991). In preparation: H.R. Panek, J. D. Stepp, H.M. Engle, S.K. Lemmon and L.C. Robinson, "Suppressors of Loss of YCK-encoded Yeast Casein Kinase 1 Define Four Subunits of a Novel Complex Related to Clathrin Adaptors". C.W. Bazinet, J. Polak, A.P. Mahowald and S.K. Lemmon, "Spermatogenic Defect of a Male- Sterile Allele of the Clathrin Heavy Chain Gene".
